CHEBI:28102 amylose A glucan composed of unbranched chains of D-glucopyranose residues in α(1→4) glycosidic linkage. The number of repeated glucose subunits (n) is usually in the range of 300 to 3000, but can be many thousands. One of the two components of starch (the other, 70-80%, being amylopectin). Cf. linear maltodextrin, in which the chain length is typically between 3 and 17 glucose units. 3 CHEBI:2694 CHEBI:22539 Amylose chain Amylose 4-{(1,4)-alpha-D-Glucosyl}(n-1)-D-glucose 1,4-alpha-D-Glucan (1,4-alpha-D-Glucosyl)n-1 (1,4-alpha-D-Glucosyl)n+1 (1,4-alpha-D-Glucosyl)n (1->4)-alpha-D-glucopyranan (C6H10O5)nH2O 0.0 0 9005-82-7 8194785 9005-82-7 HMDB0003403 C00718 D02329 G10495 Amylose 24162153 24299760 24491702 24505384
